experience.title: Software Engineer II
responsibilities: Architected a real-time fraud detection pipeline using Kafka and Flink, reducing fraudulent transactions by 34% and saving an estimated $4.2M annually
Led migration of Ruby monolith to Go microservices, cutting p99 API latency from 420ms to 85ms
Built optimized A/B testing infrastructure that enabled 60+ concurrent experiments across the Payments team
Mentored 2 junior engineers through bi-weekly 1:1s and code review sessions; both received mid-year promotions

experience.title: Software Engineer I
responsibilities: Developed dynamic surge-pricing engine in Python and AWS Lambda, processing 2M+ ride requests per hour with <100ms latency
Redesigned driver-matching algorithm, improving average match time by 22% and increasing driver acceptance rates
Shipped a self-serve analytics dashboard (React + GraphQL) used by 300+ internal stakeholders to monitor ride metrics in real-time
Automated CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions and Terraform, reducing deployment times from 45 minutes to 8 minutes

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Built a cost anomaly detection tool for the AWS Cost Explorer team using Python and scikit-learn, flagging millions in billing discrepancies
Contributed 3 production bug fixes in the first two weeks; patches shipped to 200,000+ AWS customers

experience.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
responsibilities: Implemented graph neural network models (PyTorch Geometric) for NLP citation-network tasks; results published in ACL 2021 workshop

projects.name: PocketBudget
projects.description: Personal finance tracker with ML spending predictions
highlights: Full-stack app built with Next.js, tRPC, and Plaid API integration
1,200+ active users with 4.7â˜… App Store rating
Trained an LSTM model on anonymized transaction data to predict monthly overspending with 87% accuracy

questionsAndAnswers.whyThisCompany: I'm excited about [COMPANY] because of its mission to [MISSION]. My experience building scalable systems at Stripe and Lyft aligns perfectly with the technical challenges you're solving. I'm particularly interested in [SPECIFIC_PROJECT/TEAM].
questionsAndAnswers.whyThisRole: This role combines my passion for backend systems and my experience with real-time data processing. At Stripe, I built fraud detection pipelines handling millions of transactions, which directly translates to the scale challenges mentioned in the job description.
questionsAndAnswers.greatestStrength: My greatest strength is translating complex technical problems into elegant, scalable solutions. At Stripe, I reduced fraudulent transactions by 34% through a Kafka-Flink pipeline, saving $4.2M annually.
questionsAndAnswers.greatestWeakness: I sometimes dive too deep into technical details when a simpler solution exists. I've learned to step back, validate assumptions with stakeholders, and prioritize pragmatic solutions over perfect ones.
questionsAndAnswers.conflictResolution: At Lyft, I disagreed with a senior engineer about our matching algorithm approach. I ran A/B tests comparing both methods, shared data-driven results, and we collaborated on a hybrid solution that improved metrics by 22%.
questionsAndAnswers.careerGoals: In 5 years, I see myself as a tech lead or engineering manager, leading a team solving high-impact distributed systems problems. I want to mentor engineers while staying close to the technical work.
questionsAndAnswers.whyLeaving: I'm looking for a role with deeper technical challenges in [DOMAIN] and opportunities to work on systems at even greater scale. Stripe gave me incredible growth, and I'm ready for the next challenge.
questionsAndAnswers.expectedSalary: Based on my experience and market research, I'm targeting $180,000-$220,000 base salary, plus equity. I'm flexible and open to discussing total compensation.
questionsAndAnswers.availableStartDate: I can start with 2 weeks' notice from the offer acceptance date.
questionsAndAnswers.diversityStatement: As a woman in tech, I'm passionate about building inclusive engineering cultures. At Lyft, I co-founded a women in engineering group that grew to 50+ members and ran monthly mentorship sessions.
